clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship of Motor Skill Competency and Physical Fitness to Physical Activity in Elementary School Students
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship of Motor Skill Competency and Physical Fitness to Physical Activity in Elementary School Students

brief_summary.textblock: This study examined how well elementary students demonstrated motor skill competency as a result of participating in the evidence-based quality physical education program and investigated relationships between levels of health-related physical fitness and physical activity in school-aged children.

primary_outcome.description: changes in manipulative skill between the intervention year 1 and the intervention year 2. The K-1 students' motor skill competency in running, weight transferring, hand dribbling, and underhand catching skills was assessed using four PE Metrics skill assessment rubrics in the intervention year 1 and year 2, respectively.

changes in manipulative skill between the intervention year 1 and the intervention year 2. The K-1 students' motor skill competency in running, weight transferring, hand dribbling, and underhand catching skills was assessed using four PE Metrics skill assessment rubrics in the intervention year 1 and year 2, respectively.

The K-1 students' motor skill competency in running, weight transferring, hand dribbling, and underhand catching skills was assessed using four PE Metrics skill assessment rubrics in the intervention year 1 and year 2, respectively.

changes in manipulative skill between the intervention year 1 and the intervention year 2. The K-1 students' motor skill competency in running, weight transferring, hand dribbling, and underhand catching skills was assessed using four PE Metrics skill assessment rubrics in the intervention year 1 and year 2, respectively.
Relationship between fitness and physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily physical activity participation in minutes
primary_outcome.description: Relationship between levels of fitness and daily physical activity participation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- K-5 th grade students who are enrolled in 9 elementary schools in Southeast Michigan.
Exclusion Criteria:

facility.name: School of Kinesiology, University of Michigan
